intro: Scurrula eglandulosa, commonly known as the smooth scurrula, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a fine, powdery coating. Scurrula eglandulosa is adapted to arid conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
